alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 3:57AM EST until February 05 at 4:30PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek Above Middletown. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:41 AM EST Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:41 AM EST Saturday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 5.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 04/18/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later today.
